In this video we debunk our final myth: Plastic pollution is our fault.
Check out The Plastic Diaries on the @envirodefence website to learn more about what you can do to end plastic pollution. 
It’s easy to feel responsible for the plastic mess we find ourselves in and naturally, we feel a sense of responsibility to clean it up. But plastic pollution is not your fault and you certainly can’t solve it alone.

Individual action can only do so much. It’s practically impossible to avoid plastics, and no matter how diligent of a recycler you may be, most plastic doesn’t even get recycled. In a world practically covered in non-recyclable plastic, doing ‘the right thing” can be a challenge. 
For almost 50 years, the plastics industry has strategically shifted the blame of plastic waste onto us – the consumers. Rather than invest in designing products to be recyclable, the plastics industry throws a few dollars into educating consumers on how to recycle properly, or they sponsor a few beach cleanups. And in the meantime, they fight against any laws that would force them to deal with the mess they made. 
Individuals all have a responsibility to care about the health of our planet and to drastically reduce how much plastic we use in the first place. But individual behaviour will have minor impacts without regulation. To avoid the needless creation of plastic waste that will stick around for hundreds of years, we need the government to step up and take meaningful action.

✈️😬 THIS IS NOT AN AD FOR FLYING. 😬✈️ Soon, I'm taking my 7th flight of the year. Here you go Daily Mail, have this information for free the next time you want to takedown an eco-activist. This year so far, I have taken 1 long-haul and 2 short-haul return trips with the 3rd coming up. That's a whole lot of emissions being created - roughly 2.767 tonnes of CO2 for a single traveler. (See a photo on @earthbyhelena's feed for a visual of 1 tonne 😬).⁣⁣ I'm sharing this because I want to be transparent as possible.⁣
⁣⁣⁣
🇺🇸 The long-haul was my first long-haul trip since 2001 and was in the name of a long distance friendship. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣
🇳🇱 Flying to Amsterdam was something I could have avoided which is why I am now making a commitment to turn down any future work opportunities that mean flying. I did this recently when I was offered to represent Gen Z at a corporate event in Budapest. Even though they *so badly* wanted to have me speak, doing it remotely and saving the emissions wasn't enough... for a sustainability event 😆.⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
♥️ The main reason I fly, though? Family. My parents are currently abroad which means if I want to see them, flying is the cheapest and easiest option. I don't want to make excuses. The price and ease (for an anxious solo-traveller) are the reason I haven't been by train before.⁣
⁣
So, I don't know if I can commit to not flying completely, yet. If it wasn't for people I love living far away, then I wouldn't question it. We're so lucky to live in a time when digital communication exists so we can at least stay connected in that way, without causing more damage to our future (and present).⁣
⁣⁣
When following the likes of @treesnpeace, @earthwandress and even @gretathunberg though, I think 2020 will be the year I give travelling by train some serious thought... 😬✈️⁣⁣

🥈🖐️ Am I taking part in @oxfamgb's #SecondhandSeptember which starts tomorrow? No. Why? Because I've been doing this since I can remember! Second-hand shopping is so engrained in me by now that no such challenge is necessary although of course, I absolutely advocate it for everyone else.⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
I'm reposting these clips from my Story as a lottttt of you were impressed/inspired by me taking two pieces that cost me €1 each and making them fit me like a glove. ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
See, the thing is with second-hand clothes is that not everything is perfect. The rails aren't organised, the prices are all over the place (for no rhyme or reason!) and you often find something you like that ends up being 10 sizes too big/small. But... we have to let go of perfection it we want to have a chance of turning this climate crisis thing around. (And as we all know by now, fashion isn't perfect in the first place - hence why second-hand is the way to go). ⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Even if you don't have access to a sewing machine or the time to learn - remember that there is so much we can do with those seemingly imperfect items waiting to be re-homed. How to do it? Here:⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
✂️ Support your local tailor/repairer by taking your second-hand finds in for a fix-up or re-sizing, if you're able to.⁣⁣⁣
🤝 Have a friend/family member who's a sewer? Ask for a hand! ⁣⁣⁣
🤔 Think about how you can wear something differently. Not everything has to fit perfectly or be "flattering" to look awesome. Get creative!⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣
Second-hand shopping takes more time, especially if you look past the items that are already raring to go but that's the kind of slowing down we need. #SecondhandSeptember should be all year round - just sayin' 💁🖐️🥈⁣⁣⁣

Another day, another pesto recipe 🙌🏼
Kale pesto is a great way to get in extra greens without it overpowering the basil flavor. It’s delicious and I love it!
All my pesto recipes have hemp hearts (in replacement of nuts due to my allergies) but I decided to swap them out for pumpkin seeds this time and I was not disappointed! 
Super easy recipe and tastes sooo good!
2 cups kale
1 cup basil 
1/4 cup pumpkin seeds 
1/4 cup nutritional yeast 
2 cloves garlic 
Juice of 1 lemon 
Salt & Pepper
1/3 cup olive oil. 
Mix everything in a food processor or blender and mix until everything is combined! Adding the olive oil gradually is the way to go but I usually just mix it all at once and it comes out perfectly!

In a debate, the participants who feel innately that they do not stand on the ground of reasons, will most likely default to personal insults as an armor for their anxiety.  It is the ultimate tell of someone losing their argument.  I’m not saying this to upset anyone. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣I’m simply saying this because I want to bring to light for the commenters who were angered by my last post, that the fact they are able to criticize in this space is a direct result of the very thing that they are criticizing against.  That the right of saying what they said in the place where they said it, is the fruit of the fundamental values of democracy.  To say democracy is not valid is to say that their comments are not valid, and hence saying nothing. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣Those who screamed against the desire for democracy in their comments, are already practicing democracy without knowing. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣So welcome.  You are already one of us. ⁣⁣
⁣⁣⁣⁣
⁣⁣But democracy only works on the ground of - amongst other things - freedom of information and speech.  And a well-informed speech can only be constructed and effectively delivered through facts, reasons, and the willingness to understand, sometimes even empathize with the opposition argument.  So practice it.  If you are already on Instagram, then it means you are treading beyond the firewall of censored internet in China, meaning that you already wanting more, that you have access to Google, to more than one side of the history, to the free-ranging vastness of informations, knowledge, philosophies and perspectives, the wilderness of forming your own thoughts, as scary as it is, as far as the willingness of your mind will take you. ⁣
⁣⁣
⁣So go search, absorb, struggle, evolve, and form your opinion with this powerful tool that is outlawed by the system that you are currently defending.  Be smart, be civil, convince me!  And as you are doing it, know that, hey, that good feeling that you are experiencing right now, that is what the Hong Kong people are fighting for for the next generations to come. ⁣⁣

Learn how to make PERFECT Restaurant-Style Spanish rice at home with just a few simple ingredients and about 30 minutes of your time!

Ingredients
* 1/2 tbsp avocado oil (or cooking oil of choice or sub vegetable broth for oil-free)
* 1/2 cup diced onion
* 1/4 cup diced red or green bell pepper
* 2 cloves garlic, finely minced
* 1 cup long-grain white rice
* 1 cup vegan chicken broth
* 1 cup tomato sauce
* 3/4 tsp chili powder
* 1/4 tsp ground cumin
* 1/4 tsp salt
* 1/4 tsp dried oregano
* Freshly ground black pepper, as desired
* 2-3 tbsp freshly chopped cilantro
* Lime wedges (to serve)

1. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, add in the avocado oil. Once heated, add the bell pepper, onions, and garlic and cook until softened, about 4 minutes. If you would like, you can use vegetable broth instead of oil. We recommend adding 2 tablespoons of broth (in addition to the 1 cup used in the recipe) to cook the peppers, onions and garlic until soft, adding 2 tablespoons more at a time when needed to prevent burning.
2. Add in the uncooked rice and cook, stirring frequently, until toasted or about 3 minutes.
3. Add in all of the remaining ingredients, except for the cilantro and lime, and stir until well combined.
4. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Once boiling, reduce the heat to a simmer, cover the pot and cook until all of the liquid has been absorbed by the rice, or about 16 to 18 minutes.
5. Once cooked, remove the pot from heat and allow it to sit, covered, for 4 minutes. Remove the lid and fluff the rice up.
6. Mix the cilantro into the rice and serve warm with lime if desired.

Note: The liquid required may vary depending on the rice used. We recommend you follow the directions specific to the rice that you are using to guarantee success. For example, if the rice calls for 2 cups liquid per every 1 cup rice, we suggest you use 1 cup broth and 1 cup tomato sauce. If the rice calls for 1 3/4 cups liquid per 1 cup rice, use 1 cup broth and 3/4 cup tomato sauce. Shoutout to @FiveHeartHome for this tip!

Find this recipe at: https://sweetsimplevegan.com/2019/09/easy-spanish-rice/

I’m dyslexic. I don’t think I’ve mentioned that online simply because it’s normal to me so not something I actively think about all too often.

Having dyslexia means I process information differently. Growing up and going to schools that teach in a way that don’t match my learning style was challenging and I often felt less intelligent than other students. I gravitated towards the subjects I was naturally gifted at like art, creative writing, photography, psychology and critical thinking. Maths and chemistry felt like foreign languages that got me tongue-tied. It wasn’t until I understood dyslexia that it all made sense and I discovered better habits to support me in learning in ways that suit my processing system through an environment not designed for people like me with minds like mine.

Now that I’m self-employed I have control over how I schedule my day, complete my work and learn new skills. And over the years I’ve honed the best practices that work for my learning and working style (which happens to be visual and kinaesthetic, like a lot of people with dyslexia). So I take notes. Lots of notes. On my phone, in journals, on my chalk board... if I can’t see it it didn’t happen. I easily forget information unless I have a visual reminder so taking notes is vital. I also keep a bullet journal (you may have seen my flip-through on my YouTube channel) that allows me to oversee my day, week, month and year and keep track of my life. It’s perfect for me as I can customise it to suit my exact needs and change it up when I need to.

My creative journals are also important logs. I often feel stifled without an outlet or overwhelmed without a way to let out my creative fire. Creativity is one of my dyslexic superpowers that helps uplift all other aspects of my life and bring in a new perspective when working with others.

Being uneducated about dyslexia created a hard, confusing and self-punishing environment. Now knowing my Self a little better (a lot better) I’m connected with my inner world and can dive deep into self-love, acknowledgment, gratitude, empowerment and share my gifted dyslexic Self with the world.

Have you ever tried making sweet potato tortillas? These tortilla breads are THE BOMB and they’re only 3 ingredients 🙌🏻🧡 Adding mashed sweet potatoes to a simple spelt dough makes the tortillas softer and more flavorful than regular ones. It does take a little time to roll them, but it’s really easy and will definitely up-level your taco game 🌮🌮🌮 Plan it for a weekend when you wanna eat something special 👌🏼 Recipe below!
•
Sweet Potato Tortillas
makes ~7 tortilla breads
•
3 medium sweet potatoes
4-5 dl (1 2/3 - 2 cups) fine spelt flour
1 tsp salt
•
Method:
1.  Set oven to 200’C/390’F. Prick holes into the potatoes and roast for 45 min-1 hour or until completely cooked through. Let cool a bit.
2.  Remove skins from the potatoes and place in a bowl. Mash them together with the salt. Add the spelt flour, little by little, and work it in. Use your hands or a spatula. When you have a workable dough, divide it into 7-8 pieces. On a floured surface, roll out to ~3mm thin tortilla breads. Add more flour as needed.
3.  Toast the tortilla bread (one by one) in a dry, hot skillet on both sides until it’s got a bit of color. Carefully not to burn as they toast really fast! Place under a clean kitchen towel and spray with a little water. This step is essential, as it makes the tortillas soft enough to wrap around your filling. Repeat with the rest of the dough, removing any excess flour in the pan between rounds.
4. Serve with taco filling of choice!
•

with lyme it’s impossible to know how i’ll feel one day to the next.

mid air on the flight home yesterday, i experienced a newer lyme symptom of mine (we’ll get into that another day), and had a full blown panic attack in the airplane bathroom.

my heart started racing, the walls felt like they were caving in around me, and i completely blacked out.

i knew i could either stay in there and lose my mind, or try to get it together so i did everything i could to make the latter happen.

i looked into the mirror, regained my breath, called on my angels, and calmed myself down. i got back to my seat and laid down (whole row to myself 🙏🏻), and then it happened again- but much worse.

this time i broke out in full sweats and hives and all the color drained from my face. i was shaking like a leaf and my heart felt like it was on fire. it felt impossible to draw in a breath. again i had that familiar feeling of, “this is it. this is the end.”
.
i sat up and frantically gripped everything around me trying to find my sanity and calm. i fumbled with my phone and got a meditation on, and raggedly breathed my way back into my body.

in those moments, i am so grateful for my meditation and yoga practice. i knew that if i could focus on my breath, and get my mind off of the symptoms that spiraled me into the panic, i would be okay.

it was a ROUGH flight to say the least but today i am happy to be home, yet feeling all of the exhaustion and pains of lyme tenfold.

if you’ve ever felt this way, know you’re not alone. this too shall pass. ready for all of the rest and self care this weekend after that experience... so much love to you all. ✌🏻 #soulonfire #tbbmademedoit

You can't watch The Great @BritishBakeOff without cake! So how about making this 100% vegan chocolate cake in time for the next episode? 👩‍🍳💓 Ingredients -

300g soya spread (baking & spreading) (room temperature)
300g fine raw cane sugar
1 tbsp vanilla extract
300g spelt flour
200g Plant-based alternative to yogurt sweetened with agave
2 tsp baking powder
75g cacao powder
75ml Rice-Coconut-Chocolate drink or Rice-Coconut drink
1 pinch of salt

Method -

Preheat the oven to 185°C

For the cake:
Beat the soya spread and sugar for 5 mins with a whisker or food processor, until you are left with a light texture and until the sugars is dissolved.
Add the vanilla and the yogurt and fold gently.
Sieve the flower in 3 x over the batter and gently fold until the flour is dissolved.
Do the same with the cacao powder.
Finally add the Rice-Coconut-Chocolate drink (or Rice-Coconut drink).
Stir well until you have a smooth batter.
In the meantime, grease 2 baking tins with a diameter of 18cm.
Cover them with a layer of flour.
Divide the batter equally over the tins and bake for 25 - 30 mins.
Let it cool for 5 mins in the tin and afterwards let it further cool outside the tin.

For the frosting:
Fill the bottom of a cooking pot with some water.
Put a bowl on top of the pot. Make sure the water does not touch the bowl.
Let the water come to boiling point, but don’t let it further boil.
Put the following ingredients in the bowl and stir until you have a shiny mixture and the chocolate is molten: 300g powdered sugar, 200g soya spread, 5 tbsp Rice-Coconut-Chocolate drink, 100g vegan chocolate, 2 tbsp cacao powder.
Let it cool.
Cover the top of 1 cake with part of the frosting.
Sprinkle with the raspberries, red berries + other berries.
Put the 2nd cake on top of this and gently push.
Generously cover the top with the frosting and decorate.
Enjoy! ⠀ .⠀

MORNING ROUTINE ✌🏽🥥💦 By a show of hands,👋🏽🤙🏼✌🏽who starts their day with a glass or water or some sort of cleansing process? And if you care to share what that is, please enlighten us! ☀️I’m always so intrigued and inspired to hear what others do! Personally, when I’m drinking room temp water, adding a little lemon, maybe a little apple cider vinegar and some molasses first thing in the morning I feel at ultimate best! The other thing I do, is eat melons only on an empty stomach! I have always had sensitive digestion and knowing melons digest in 5 min where as everything else including other fruits take longer, they really do best first thing in the morning! 
For breakfast we almost always have a smoothie, the kids they might have oatmeal or toast too. (I feel better with just a litre sized smoothie) and that’s usually after the kids are in school. I try to exercise in the morning but if I can’t I do a quick dry brush (been extra into that lately)  to get the lymphatic fired up (feels so good after) and do a couple push ups or something to get the blood flowing- I can’t not do something physical... It makes everything better and I know that about myself (especially if baby’s been up a lot that night)! For the kids I notice such a huge direct correlation between good nutrition and happy dispositions! If they are nourished and hydrated they are angels! It’s when do much breads and empty calories (cereals) take over that I start to notice their pep damper! And happy kids are the absolute best energy and makes life that much more enjoyable which is one easy motivator to feed them good! They also always skateboard surf  or ride their bike before school to get their blood pumping too!
So that’s what’s going on over here! How about you?! (I should note - Shem and I are about the same most days! (And I should note we didn’t always have a supportive start to our days! Use to be more like bread and store bought waffles and cereals) - but definitely  gotten better over the years and it’s definitely made a big positive difference worth being amped on!😜🍇🍍🥥🥑💦 #morningroutine PS can you tell our kitchen is different! 🙌🏽

Today is World Water Day and it is an important time to reflect on what you can do for the most precious, life-giving resource on Earth. This photo was taken by us in the Toronto harbour last summer and shows the tremendous amount of plastic waste filling up in our Great Lakes. Unfortunately this scene is an all too common sight along every coastline in the world nowadays and in order to change this situation it is going to take significant collective action. Not just by participating in things like beach cleanups or recycling more, but by outright refusing single use plastic waste as much as possible and by demanding that businesses and politicians eliminate these types of wasteful plastics from being created in the first place. This is a fight about banning or redesigning certain polluting products altogether and by starting a revolution against our throwaway culture. This is a fight about the health of our entire environment and every living thing, including your own health as well. If you live in the Great Lakes region your body is 70% Great Lakes water, the same water in this picture. But of course there are a lot more challenges facing our water than plastic pollution. Which is why we also challenge you to do things like change your diet and eat less meat and when you eat seafood to only support sustainable fisheries that are traceable and local if possible. Support environmental organizations and vote for politicians that take these issues seriously, hold the corporate polluters financially responsible and transition us away from fossil fuels. Talk about these issues with your friends and family and get outside and enjoy being around nature and water whenever you can! There is a lot be worried about these days but even more to be hopeful for. Happy World Water Day! 🌍 💧#worldwaterday

Happy Earth Day! We may be a day late but every day is Earth Day for us so... 🤷‍♂️ 🌍

If you want to take a simple action for the earth and water then we recommend choosing at least one day every week (or hopefully more!) to eat a plant based diet. Livestock production is responsible for the majority of global habitat loss and leaves less space for wild animals to flourish compared to plant production. It uses far more water as well. Livestock production is also responsible for about 15% of our greenhouse gas emissions. For those of you who already eat plant based foods every day then congrats! You already know why this is so important for both the planet and the welfare of farm animals themselves. Our bonus tip then is to cut down on food waste which affects nearly half of the food produced in Canada.

Eating meat itself is not inherently bad. It can be done sustainably and we should support those that farm responsibly, but it can’t be done on an industrial scale to feed meat intensive diets to 7 billion + people without causing irreparable harm to the natural world. It also will be very difficult to convince everyone to change their diets, especially for those who depend on small scale livestock farming to survive. Which is why it is so important for those of us who have the ability to change our diets start one day or meal at a time asap. If you want to learn more about these issues and some exciting emerging solutions, please check out our episode More Food, Less Water 🌎 💧#earthday
